intro: Tribulus angustifolius var. clementii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Tribulus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Zygophyllaceae family and is known for its hardy nature. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
